bibl.title: In Re: Application of N. T. B. Pentreath for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District Of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol2.

person.persName: J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States in the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
IN THE MATTER OF N. T. B. PENTREATH ON HABEAS CORPUS.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of N. T. B. Pentreath for a writ of Habeas Corpus.

An application for a writ of Habeas Corpus in the above entitled action, having been made before me on the 30th day of March 1905, and upon proper showing the writ having been issued as prayed for, and made returnable on the 31st day of March 1905, and upon said day of return the respondent Thomas Delaney Chief of Police for the City of Seattle, having appeared by and through D. F. Willard captain of said police who was acting as substitute for said Thomas Delaney, and had then and there the body of the petitioner.

Upon reading the return of the respondent and listening to the argument of the counsel, the Court being fully advised was convinced that the petitioner was arrested and had been restrained of his liberty by the respondent contrary to the constitution of the United States, and it is hereby - Ordered, Adjudged, and Decreed: - that the said petitioner shall and is hereby released from custody, and the respondent shall pay the costs in these proceedings.
In the United States Circuit Court FOR THE Western DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON Northern Division
In the matter of the application of N. T. B. Pentreath for writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington.
J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application of B. T. B. Pentreath for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
The following costs are taxed against the respondent in the above entitled proceedings.
J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan
Atty for N. T. B Pentreath
In the United States Circuit Court
FOR THE Western DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In the matter of the application of N. T. B. Pentreath for a writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington.
J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan
